dt: {bc}a noticeable and usually significant difference or dissimilarity

dt.t: The fact is that America's colleges … have lately been exacerbating more than ameliorating the widening {wi}disparity{/wi} of wealth and opportunity in American society.
… in no other composer is the {wi}disparity{/wi} between the man and his work so immense. Bach's life is considered stupefyingly ordinary, but his music is divine …

et: borrowed from Middle French & Late Latin; Middle French {it}disparité,{/it} borrowed from Late Latin {it}disparitāt-, disparitās,{/it} from Latin {it}dispar-, dispār{/it} "unequal, different" (from {it}dis-{/it} {et_link|dis-|dis-} + {it}par-, pār{/it} "matching, equal," of uncertain origin) + {it}-itāt-, -itās{/it} {et_link|-ity|-ity}
shortdef: a noticeable and usually significant difference or dissimilarity
